definition: to freeze/to feel very cold/aspic or jelly
"ice" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 15), occurring in 冰[bing1], 次[ci4] etc, known as 兩點水|两点水[liang3 dian3 shui3]
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
to freeze (water etc)/(fig.) to freeze (assets, prices etc)
to melt/to thaw/to defrost/fig. to relax (repression, enmity etc)
to freeze to death/to die off in winter
cold weather, frozen ground (idiom); bitterly cold
to freeze over (of water or land)

sentences.english: Food grade polished aluminium cubes to be frozen and used in drinks as ice cubes.
sentences.chinese: 用食用色素處理過的凍鋁塊放到飲料裏當冰塊。

sentences.english: He tried to protect the child from the cold.
sentences.chinese: 他試圖使孩子不被凍着。

sentences.english: But his tail had been caught in the ice which had frozen over during the night and as he pulled, it broke off : Whack!
sentences.chinese: 但是它的尾巴已經被牢牢地凍在冰裏了。

sentences.english: If you get too chilly, there is a warming lobby.
sentences.chinese: 如果你凍着了，可以到休息室裏，那裏提供暖氣。

sentences.english: Alaska Pollock fillets IQF, interleaved, Block.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉斯加狹鱈魚片，單凍，分層，塊凍。

sentences.english: The hands are cold, but the heart is warm.
sentences.chinese: 我們的手雖然凍，但心是熱的。

sentences.english: Mr.Wood, the shipment of frozen prawn arrived in Singapore on November 10.
sentences.chinese: 伍德先生，那批凍對蝦於11月10人哦抵達新加坡。
加上風凍效應是零下三十度。

sentences.english: I've been taught some of business's most valuable lessons the hard, painful way.
sentences.chinese: 受過餓捱過凍，得來的是生意場上最寶貴的經驗教訓。

sentences.english: Americano canbe changed to Milktea, Fruit Honey Tea , Cold Lemon Cola.
sentences.chinese: 美式咖啡可換奶茶，蜂蜜柚子茶，凍檸樂。

sentences.english: Water expands when frozen; allow enough room for this expansion.
sentences.chinese: 凍的水會膨脹，要留足夠的空間。

sentences.english: A delicate, light-bodied red wine that should be served slightly chilled.
sentences.chinese: 精緻明亮的酒體，需要在稍凍情況下飲用。

sentences.english: Clotted cream in all its yellow gorgeousness would be very good here, too.
sentences.chinese: 在那絢麗金黃色中填滿凍奶油也是非常不錯的。

sentences.english: Had to warm to cold face.
Like sticky capsules filled with jelly.
sentences.chinese: 就像黏黏的膠囊注滿了凍糊糊。

sentences.english: Fill the savarin moulds with yogurt mixture. Keep in refrigerator for at least 4 ours or until the mixture is set.
sentences.chinese: 將乳酪凍倒入模內，放雪櫃內最少4小時待完全凝固。

definition: the five Liang of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Liang 前涼|前凉 (314-376), Later Liang 後涼|后凉 (386-403), Northern Liang 北涼|北凉 (398-439), Southern Liang 南涼|南凉 (397-414), Western Liang 西涼|西凉 (400-421)
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
warm/lukewarm/temperature/to warm up/mild/soft/tender/to review (a lesson etc)/fever (TCM)/old variant of 瘟[wen1]
cold weather, frozen ground (idiom); bitterly cold
